Name.BusinessNameLine1: THE PRESERVATION SOCIETY OF NEWPORT COUNTY

IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: TO PROTECT, PRESERVE, AND PRESENT AN EXCEPTIONAL COLLECTION OF HOUSE MUSEUMS AND LANDSCAPES.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE PRESERVATION SOCIETY OF NEWPORT COUNTY'S MISSION IS TO PROTECT, PRESERVE, AND PRESENT AN EXCEPTIONAL COLLECTION OF HOUSE MUSEUMS AND LANDSCAPES IN ONE OF THE MOST HISTORICALLY INTACT CITIES IN AMERICA. WE HOLD IN PUBLIC TRUST THE NEWPORT MANSIONS, WHICH ARE AN INTEGRAL PART OF THE LIVING FABRIC OF NEWPORT, RHODE ISLAND. THESE SITES EXEMPLIFY THREE CENTURIES OF THE FINEST ACHIEVEMENTS IN AMERICAN ARCHITECTURE, DECORATIVE ARTS, AND LANDSCAPE DESIGN SPANNING THE COLONIAL ERA TO THE GILDED AGE. THROUGH OUR HISTORIC PROPERTIES, EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS, AND RELATED ACTIVITIES WE ENGAGE THE PUBLIC IN THE STORY OF AMERICA'S VIBRANT CULTURAL HERITAGE. WE SEEK TO INSPIRE AND PROMOTE AN APPRECIATION OF THE VALUE OF PRESERVATION TO ENRICH THE LIVES OF PEOPLE EVERYWHERE.
IRS990.Description: THE PRESERVATION SOCIETY OF NEWPORT COUNTY PRESERVES ELEVEN HISTORIC MANSIONS, INCLUDING SEVEN NATIONAL HISTORIC LANDMARKS AND EIGHTY ACRES OF PARKS, GARDENS AND GROUNDS, REPRESENTING MORE THAN 250 YEARS OF SOCIAL AND ARCHITECTURAL HISTORY. EACH YEAR OVER 750,000 VISITORS TAKE REGULARLY-SCHEDULED TOURS OF THE SOCIETY'S PROPERTIES TO LEARN ABOUT THE BUILDINGS AND THE MEN AND WOMEN WHO GAVE RISE TO THESE SPECIAL PLACES. IN ADDITION TO GENERAL TOURS, THE PRESERVATION SOCIETY OFFERS MANY OTHER LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES, DESIGNED TO PRESENT ITS HOUSES AND COLLECTIONS TO A BROAD AND DIVERSE AUDIENCE IN AS MANY INTERESTING AND ENLIGHTENING WAYS AS POSSIBLE. THESE PROGRAMS INCLUDE INTERNATIONAL SYMPOSIA AND FORUMS, STUDY DAYS, LECTURES, WORKSHOPS, FILMS, TOURS, AND THE OPPORTUNITY FOR VISITORS TO EXPERIENCE THE TYPE OF GRAND ENTERTAINING FOR WHICH THEY WERE BUILT. EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS ARE OFFERED YEAR-ROUND.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of How Organization Reports Conservation Easements:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE PRESERVATION SOCIETY OF NEWPORT COUNTY HOLDS CONSERVATION EASEMENTS ON FOUR PROPERTIES, WHICH WERE PRIMARILY FORMERLY OWNED BY THE SOCIETY. THE SOCIETY DOES NOT ACCEPT DONATED EASEMENTS NOR DOES IT PURCHASE EASEMENTS AS PART OF ITS PROGRAM ACTIVITIES. THERE IS NO VALUE ASSIGNED TO THE SOCIETY'S CONSERVATION EASEMENTS, AND NO FINANCIAL TRANSACTIONS ARISE FROM ITS EASEMENTS. THEREFORE, THE EASEMENTS ARE NOT REFLECTED IN THE STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES OR THE STATEMENT OF FINANCIAL POSITION.

PER THE SOCIETY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENT FOOTNOTES: THE HISTORICAL COLLECTIONS ARE NOT CAPITALIZED BY THE SOCIETY. IN ADDITION, THE SOCIETY DOES NOT CAPITALIZE REPAIRS OR IMPROVEMENTS TO INEXHAUSTIBLE COLLECTIONS. ALL PURCHASES OF COLLECTION ITEMS AND RESTORATION OR IMPROVEMENTS TO INEXHAUSTIBLE COLLECTIONS ARE RECORDED AS DECREASES IN UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS IN THE YEAR IN WHICH THE EXPENDITURE IS MADE. DONATIONS OF HISTORICAL COLLECTION ITEMS ARE RECORDED IN THE STATEMENT OF ACTIVITIES AND CHANGES IN NET ASSETS AT THEIR FAIR OR APPRAISED VALUES ON THE DATE OF DONATION AND ARE EXPENSED IN THE YEAR RECEIVED IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SOCIETY'S NON-CAPITALIZATION POLICY.

THE COLLECTIONS OF THE PRESERVATION SOCIETY OF NEWPORT COUNTY'S HOUSE MUSEUMS, COMPRISING OVER 50,000 OBJECTS, REFLECT THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION TO PRESENT AND PRESERVE AMERICAN ARCHITECTURE AND DECORATIVE ARTS SPANNING THE COLONIAL ERA TO THE GILDED AGE. THE COLLECTIONS, OTHER THAN ARCHIVAL MATERIALS AND FRAGILE TEXTILES, ARE PERMANENTLY EXHIBITED IN THEIR ORIGINAL HISTORIC CONTEXT OF DOMESTIC INTERIORS AND REFLECT A UNIQUE SURVEY OF THE EVOLUTION OF AMERICAN DESIGN.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Intended Use of Endowment Funds:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES, INCLUDING MAINTAINING THE HISTORIC HOUSES AND OTHER HISTORICAL TREASURES IN THE ORGANIZATION'S COLLECTIONS AND SUPPORTING CERTAIN ANNUAL EDUCATIONAL EVENTS.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: The Society is exempt from income taxes as a public charity under Section 501(c)(3) of the Internal Revenue Code. Management believes that the Society has done nothing during the past year that would jeopardize its tax-exempt status at either the state or federal level. Authoritative guidance requires the evaluation of tax positions taken or expected to be taken in the course of preparing the Society's tax returns to determine whether the tax positions are "more likely than not" to be sustained by the applicable tax authority. Tax positions not deemed to meet the "more likely than not" threshold would be recorded as a tax benefit or expense in the current year. The Society annually files IRS Form 990 - Return of Organization Exempt From Income Tax reporting various information that the IRS uses to monitor the activities of tax-exempt entities. The Society also annually files IRS Form 990-T - Exempt Organization's Business Income Tax Return for all of its taxable transactions. These tax returns are subject to review by the taxing authorities. The federal income tax returns for 2007, 2008, and 2009 are subject to examination by the IRS, generally for three years after they were filed. The Society currently has no tax examinations in progress. For the Society's tax year ending March 31, 2010 the Society paid no income taxes related to its taxable sales.
EXPENSES IN PART VIII, LINE 10B: -1524969. EXPENSES IN PART VIII, LINE 8B: -17357.
EXPENSES IN PART VIII, LINE 10B: 1524969. EXPENSES IN PART VIII, LINE 8B: 17357.

Form990ScheduleJPartIII.Explanation: PHILLIP PELLETIER RECEIVES INCENTIVE COMPENSATION BASED ON BOOKED EVENTS. IN 2009, PHILLIP PELLETIER RECEIVED BASE COMPENSATION OF $95,000 AND INCENTIVE COMPENSATION OF $7,864.

OtherNonCashContributionsTable.MethodOfDeterminingRevenues: COST OR SELLING PRICE PER THE DONOR
COST OR SELLING PRICE PER THE DONOR
COST OR SELLING PRICE PER THE DONOR

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Identifier: Method for Determining Number of Contributors:
Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: FOR CONTRIBUTIONS OF ITEMS WHICH ARE ACCESSIONED, THE ORGANIZATION IDENTIFIES EACH GIFT RECEIVED AND REPORTS THE TOTAL NUMBER OF GIFTS (SOME GIFTS CONTAIN MULITPLE ITEMS). FOR OTHER TYPES OF NON-CASH CONTRIBUTIONS, THE ORGANIZATION IDENTIFIES EACH DONOR BY PURPOSE, SUCH AS A SPECIFIC EVENT. THE ORGANIZATION REPORTS THE SUM OF THE TOTAL NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTORS FOR EACH PURPOSE. SOME CONTRIBUTORS ARE INCLUDED MULTIPLE TIMES, FOR EACH DISCRETE INSTANCE OF PROVIDING A NON-CASH CONTRIBUTION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 HAS BEEN PREPARED BY THE SOCIETY'S EXTERNAL AUDITORS AND REVIEWED IN DRAFT WITH THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, DIRECTOR OF FINANCE AND THE TREASURER. CORRECTIONS AND CHANGES WERE MADE AS NECESSARY. THE BOARD HAS DELEGATED THE PROCESS OF REVIEWING THE 990 TO THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE, THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, THE TREASURER AND THE CHAIRMAN OF THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: EACH YEAR THE ORGANIZATION'S CODE OF ETHICS IS PROVIDED TO ALL OFFICERS, DIRECTORS AND KEY EMPLOYEES. THESE PEOPLE ARE ASKED TO REVIEW THE CODE AND SIGN A STATEMENT INDICATING THAT THEY UNDERSTAND IT, HAVE REPORTED ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS DURING THE PAST YEAR IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE POLICY AND WILL REPORT ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS DURING THE COMING YEAR. ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ARE EVALUATED BY THE BOARD TO DETERMINE IF A CONFLICT ACTUALLY EXISTS. IN THOSE INSTANCES WHERE THE POTENTIAL TRANSACTION IS A CONFLICT THE BOARD EXAMINES THE TRANSACTION AND A VOTE IS TAKEN (WITH THOSE INVOLVED RECUSING THEMSELVES) AS TO WHETHER THE ORGANIZATION WILL ENTER INTO THE TRANSACTION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANNUALLY THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD CONDUCTS A PERFORMANCE REVIEW AND EVALUATION OF THE CEO. THE REVIEW ALSO ESTABLISHES THE CEO'S COMPENSATION FOR THE FOLLOWING YEAR. THIS PROCESS INVOLVES THE EVALUATION OF THE CEO, AND A REVIEW OF COMPENSATION OF COMPARABLE POSITIONS OBTAINED FROM THE FORMS 990 OF SIMILAR ORGANIZATIONS. THE COMMITTEE'S DELIBERATION AND DECISION ARE NOTED IN THE MINUTES OF THE MEETING. THE PAY FOR ALL OTHER EMPLOYEES, INCLUDING THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCE, KEY EMPLOYEES AND HIGHEST COMPENSATED EMPLOYEES, IS DETERMINED BY THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS (ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION AND BY-LAWS), ITS CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND PUBLIC TAX RETURNS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE ORGANIZATION WILL MAIL COPIES OR PROVIDE COPIES TO THOSE WHO COME TO THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE DURING NORMAL BUSINESS HOURS. THE ORGANIZATION CURRENTLY DOES NOT CHARGE FOR THE COPIES.
